2017-07-15 15:15:01.text: Autocompletion in emacs?  Anyone using one they like, if so would love to know more about it.

2017-07-16 13:23:56.text: I used autocomplete with Visual Studio's IDE a little bit when I was first starting to learn and it is really nice.  You would love it, a lot less typing.

2017-07-16 06:42:26.text: <@U51N6GG75> tell me more about this -- I don't use any auto complete features at the moment but depending on the language emacs has limited built in support

2017-07-16 13:25:01.text: A really good one and you are basically just spelling the first letter or first 2 letters of function/variable names and then tab to complete

2017-07-16 13:26:37.text: It appears that there combinations of packages to get the full experience.

2017-07-16 13:32:30.text: It usually saves the most typing when writing HTML but is  a huge reducer of keystrokes for any language.

2017-07-16 13:23:03.text: I have read enough online to know that autocomplete is possible on emacs but there are different packages, so wanted to know which one people were using.  This Reddit thread has a lot of different suggestions, but is a year old.  <https://www.reddit.com/r/emacs/comments/49ee8f/autocompletion_in_emacs_what_to_do/>

2017-07-16 13:31:05.text: So you would have autocomplete for words you have already typed but also language specific autocomplete, so if you started typing "st" would have "strcpy()" pop up.
